intro: Thlaspi caerulescens subsp. sylvestre, commonly known as the forest pennycress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, yellow flowers and has distinctive lobed leaves. This subspecies is known for its ability to accumulate heavy metals, making it useful in phytoremediation efforts.
